info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:11AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON, CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON, CLERMONT AND NORTHWESTERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 545 AM EDT... At 510 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Newport, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Fort Thomas, Newport, Alexandria, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Dayton, Southgate, Claryville, Amelia, Mount Orab, Wilder, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Batavia and Silver Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
